intro: Stachytarpheta mutabilis, commonly known as the variable ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from violet to white. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are often visited by hummingbirds and other pollinators, making it an important species in local ecosystems. The plant is also known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its vibrant blooms.
